ARTICLE.TITLE: New owner takes on riverfront dump clean up
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Sunshine Coast property entrepreneur Keith Grisman has bought a 4.12ha block at Coolum Beach that is the subject of a Sunshine Coast Council enforcement order.

Sunshine Coast property entrepreneur Keith Grisman has bought a 4.12ha block at Coolum Beach that is the subject of a Sunshine Coast Council enforcement order.

A Coast "property entrepreneur" says he has started work to clean up a recently-purchased riverfront block that had been used as a construction waste dump.

Keith Grisman, whose website describes him as a property entrepreneur, bought the West Coolum Rd site after it went to public auction in May.

Ultimate fixer-upper a bargain for buyer with right 'skills'

CLEAN IT UP: Coast creek property crackdown

Mr Grisman is also a founder of office space letting company The Boarding Office and Property Only and was previously the managing director of Wave Group.

The 4.12ha block has been bought from previous owner Michelle Casaubon by Ring Fence Pty Ltd, of which Mr Grisman is sole director.

Mr Grisman has bought the West Coolum Creek Road property. Photo: Patrick Woods

That company was registered with the Australian Securities and Investments Commission on May 5, less than a week before the block went to auction.

The block is the subject of enforcement action by Sunshine Coast Council over fill dumped on site containing construction waste including asbestos.

In buying the block, Mr Grisman also bought the responsibility for its rehabilitation.

"We intend to comply with the enforcement notice and we have appointed an environmental consultant to get started," Mr Grisman said.

The site has also been included on the Environmental Management Register, with the Department of Environment and Science responsible for determining if and when it would be suitable to build a home on.

The rehabilitation required to get the property to residential standard goes far beyond that currently required by the council enforcement notice.

A Sunshine Coast Council spokesman said the council was requesting the new owner comply with the current enforcement notice, requiring remediation of the site by November 30.

"This remediation requires the removal of any asbestos from the surface of the property and capping of the affected area with clean fill," the spokesman said.

METADATA.description: A Coast “property entrepreneur” says he has started work to clean up a recently-purchased riverfront block that had been used as a construction waste dump.
METADATA.author: Stuart Cumming
METADATA.keywords: asbestos, contamination, coolum-beach, keith-grisman, propertyrehabilitation, rehabilitation, sunshine-coast, sunshine-coast-council
